event_text: The apprentices of the Clan are taking special training to learn how to survive in underground tunnels long-term, in the case of a siege conducted by o_c_n.

As the wind howls on the plains outside, m_c is tucked up in the medicine cat den, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep anything but restful. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/keep/keeps} seeing flashes of prophecy_list_sight. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} with a shiver, wondering what {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dreams mean for the Clan.

m_c leaps and gracefully sweeps across the plains of c_n territory. m_c quickly scans the scenery around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} inbetween leaps, and quickly finds that a acc_singular has joined {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} walk. m_c decides to keep it when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/speed/speeds} back to camp.

m_c and r_c both leap and gracefully sweep across the plains of c_n territory. m_c quickly scans the scenery around them both inbetween a shared leap, and quickly finds that a acc_singular has joined {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} walk. m_c decides to keep it when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/speed/speeds} back to camp.

r_c spots acc_singular near camp. Before r_c can rip {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} way through camp and to the acc_singular, m_c stops {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and tells {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/want/wants} it as a pet. r_c opens {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth to hiss at m_c, but the kit bounds over to the acc_singular. Guess it's too late to catch it...

m_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/focus/focuses} on a rabbit near the dirt-place. m_c has been taught all {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life that hunting was the only thing that a warrior did near rabbits... but this one was so cute. m_c wanders towards it, and quickly befriends it!
m_c found a small little patch of bright yellow flowers in camp, and snagged one to decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with!
r_c takes m_c by surprise, swiftly decorating m_c with pretty yellow blooms. Bewildered, m_c thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the gift.
m_c purrs as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/stretch/stretches} smugly in the middle of camp, showing off the new purple blooms that decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
r_c, inbetween grooming m_c, gently dots m_c's fur with shades of purple flowers during a low sunset.
m_c plucks a few marigolds from a nearby flower patch. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/wears/wear} it with poise.
r_c, inbetween grooming m_c, tucks marigolds next to m_c's ear. m_c almost doesn't notice the next morning, and purrs a thank you to r_c when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} by.

m_c's eyes sparkle as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/realizes/realize} something wonderful --- {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can propagate the bamboo on the edges of c_n territory, and decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest with it! A week later, m_c is seen sleeping soundly with leafy stalks of bamboo casting shadows on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

r_c has a wonderful idea for decorating m_c's nest! m_c wakes up in the middle of the night with bamboo brushing {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face. Despite the slight scare it gave m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/thanks/thank} r_c in the morning for the nice surprise.

r_c watches with exhausted eyes as m_c violently digs a hole off to the side of c_n camp, flinging dirt everywhere. m_c approaches less than a minute later, covered in dirt and with a long worm in their jaws. Mumbled, m_c asks if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can keep {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new friend. Exasperated, r_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} yes and to not dig holes in camp, and then tiredly walks over to clean up m_c's mess.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wondered into the warrior's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a piece of grass.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wondered into the nursery. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a piece of grass.
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wondered into the apprentice's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a piece of grass.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
r_c and m_c, on a walk together, stumble upon an acc_singular. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head, and decides to take it home! r_c is charmed by m_c's generosity.
m_c grins toothily at a acc_singular that wondered into camp! Instead of diving toward it like anyone would expect a cat to do, m_c decides to befriend it with seeds and nuts.

r_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunches/hunch} down to watch a mouse nibble at a fat seed! m_c stops r_c before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} pounce, and manages to.. befriend the mouse! r_c rolls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, grumbling about wasted food.
The things {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw today, omen_list_sight... m_c isolates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} in the shifting long grass, considering what the omens foretell.
